title: Purse, 1640–1700
medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: tapestry woven
description: Small flat envelope-shaped case, probably for letters. Dark red silk, basket weave, with woven design in cream color. Back has woven design of a fleur-de-lis on an orb with crown above, and flanked by two lions rampant. Flap, symmetrical foliage decoration. Clasp is lyre-shaped in silver. Blue silk lining. Same pattern on both sides.

tombstone.epitaph:
Purse, 1640–1700.
1640–1700. Medium: silk, metal
Technique: tapestry woven. Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf. 1951-105-14.
